findings.title: Base64-encoded value near secret-like key
findings.description: A base64-encoded value was assigned to a secret-like key.
findings.risk: Base64 is often used to encode secrets, not protect them. If sensitive, this may expose credentials.
findings.confidenceRationale: Base64 values are common and ambiguous without context.
findings.recommendation: Confirm whether the value is sensitive. If it is, rotate it and store it securely outside source control.
